intro: Rochea bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored rochea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with white petals and a yellow center, often appearing in clusters. Rochea bicolor typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
